# SPEC 02: Core Features (Hero, Schedule, Pricing)
**Component:** Homepage Hero, Class Schedule, and Pricing Display
**Priority:** P0 - Critical
**Parallel Execution:** Tasks 1-3 parallel, 4-6 parallel, 7-9 parallel

## High-Level Context
Implement the three most critical conversion-driving features: an engaging hero section with video background, a clear class schedule display, and compelling pricing cards. These features directly address the 90% bounce rate issue and establish the primary conversion funnel.

## Mid-Level Objectives
- Create compelling hero section with "Sabor in every step, flow in every move ðŸ’«"
- Display static Sunday class schedule (12-3PM)
- Replace table-based pricing with modern card layout
- Implement mobile-responsive design for all components
- Add interactive elements (CTAs, calculator)

## Implementation Notes
- Use Django templates with modern CSS/JS
- Implement mobile-first responsive design
- Follow BEM naming convention for CSS classes
- Use CSS Grid and Flexbox for layouts
- Ensure fast loading with optimized assets
- Progressive enhancement approach

## Required Context
- Foundation setup from SPEC_01 completed
- Database models created and migrated
- Base templates structure in place
- Static file directories organized
- Brand colors: Gold (#C7B375), Black (#000000)

## Beginning Context (Prerequisites)
### Available Files
- `templates/base.html` - Base template with blocks
- `static/css/base.css` - Base styles with CSS variables
- `core/views.py` - Views file for page logic
- `core/urls.py` - URL routing
- Database with Class model

### System State
- Django development server running
- Admin interface functional
- Static files serving correctly
- Database connection established

## Ending Context (Deliverables)
### Files to Create/Modify
- `templates/home.html` - Homepage with hero section
- `templates/schedule.html` - Class schedule page
- `templates/pricing.html` - Pricing page
- `static/css/hero.css` - Hero section styles
- `static/css/schedule.css` - Schedule styles
- `static/css/pricing.css` - Pricing card styles
- `static/js/pricing-calculator.js` - Pricing calculator logic
- `static/videos/hero-loop.mp4` - Hero background video
- `core/views.py` - Updated with new views

### System State
- Homepage displaying with hero section
- Class schedule showing Sunday classes
- Pricing cards with calculator functional
- All pages mobile responsive
- CTAs linking to appropriate pages

## Low-Level Tasks (Implementation Prompts)

### Task 1: Create Homepage View and Template
**Prompt**: "In core/views.py, create a home_view that renders templates/home.html. Create the home.html template extending base.html with a hero section containing the headline 'Sabor in every step, flow in every move ðŸ’«', two CTA buttons ('Book Your Class' and 'View Schedule'), and a trust indicator showing '200+ Happy Dancers'. Add URL routing in core/urls.py."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Home view created and routed to '/'
- [ ] Hero section with correct headline
- [ ] Two CTA buttons styled prominently
- [ ] Trust indicator displayed

### Task 2: Implement Hero Video Background
**Prompt**: "Add a video background to the hero section using HTML5 video element. The video should autoplay, loop, be muted, and have a poster image fallback. Add an overlay div with semi-transparent black background (rgba(0,0,0,0.5)) to ensure text readability. Style in static/css/hero.css with full viewport height."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Video element with autoplay, loop, muted attributes
- [ ] Poster image for video loading
- [ ] Semi-transparent overlay for text contrast
- [ ] Full viewport height (100vh) hero section

### Task 3: Style Hero Section
**Prompt**: "Create static/css/hero.css with styles for the hero section. Use CSS Grid to center content, add text-shadow for readability, style CTAs with gold gradient background, and ensure mobile responsiveness. Primary CTA should be gold (#C7B375) with black text, secondary CTA should be transparent with gold border."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Content centered with CSS Grid
- [ ] CTAs styled according to brand colors
- [ ] Text readable over video
- [ ] Mobile responsive (stack CTAs on small screens)

### Task 4: Create Schedule View and Template
**Prompt**: "Create schedule_view in core/views.py that fetches Class objects from database for Sunday classes. Create templates/schedule.html displaying classes in a clean grid layout. Show three time slots: 12PM-1PM (SCF Choreo Team), 1PM-2PM (Pasos BÃ¡sicos), 2PM-3PM (Casino Royale). Include instructor name, level, and description for each."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Schedule view fetches Sunday classes
- [ ] Three classes displayed with times
- [ ] Instructor and level information shown
- [ ] Links to Facebook Events and Pastio.fun

### Task 5: Style Schedule Display
**Prompt**: "Create static/css/schedule.css with card-based layout for class schedule. Use CSS Grid for responsive 3-column layout on desktop, single column on mobile. Add hover effects with transform: translateY(-5px) and box-shadow. Include level badges with colors: Beginner (green), Intermediate (gold), Advanced (red)."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Card-based design for each class
- [ ] Responsive grid layout
- [ ] Hover animations on cards
- [ ] Color-coded level badges

### Task 6: Add Schedule Booking Integration
**Prompt**: "Add 'Book Private Lesson' buttons to schedule cards that open Calendly widget in a modal. Include links to external event platforms with icons for Facebook Events and Pastio.fun. Add a note about checking these platforms for special events and workshops."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Calendly booking buttons on cards
- [ ] External platform links with icons
- [ ] Special events notice
- [ ] Modal functionality for Calendly

### Task 7: Create Pricing View and Template
**Prompt**: "Create pricing_view in core/views.py with pricing data: Drop-in $20, 4-class package $70, 8-class package $120, Private lessons $75-120/hour. Create templates/pricing.html with three pricing cards using modern card design. Highlight the 4-class package as 'Most Popular'."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Pricing view with all options
- [ ] Three distinct pricing cards
- [ ] 'Most Popular' badge on 4-class package
- [ ] Private lesson pricing range shown

### Task 8: Implement Pricing Calculator
**Prompt**: "Create static/js/pricing-calculator.js with an interactive savings calculator. Allow users to input number of classes per month and show comparison between drop-in pricing and package savings. Display savings amount and percentage. Update dynamically as user changes input."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Input for classes per month
- [ ] Real-time calculation updates
- [ ] Savings amount and percentage shown
- [ ] Visual highlight when packages save money

### Task 9: Style Pricing Cards
**Prompt**: "Create static/css/pricing.css with modern card styling. Use CSS Grid for 3-column layout, add gradient borders using before/after pseudo-elements, implement hover effects with scale transform. Most Popular card should be slightly larger with gold gradient background."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Modern card design with shadows
- [ ] Gradient borders on cards
- [ ] Most Popular card emphasized
- [ ] Responsive layout for mobile

### Task 10: Create Mobile Navigation
**Prompt**: "Update base.html with a hamburger menu for mobile navigation. Create static/js/mobile-nav.js for toggle functionality. Style with static/css/navigation.css ensuring 44px minimum touch targets. Menu should slide in from right with smooth transition."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Hamburger icon visible on mobile
- [ ] Smooth slide-in animation
- [ ] 44px minimum touch targets
- [ ] Overlay when menu is open

### Task 11: Add Page Metadata
**Prompt**: "Add SEO metadata to each template: title tags, meta descriptions, Open Graph tags for social sharing. Homepage title: 'Sabor con Flow Dance - Cuban Salsa Classes in Boulder', description focusing on Sunday classes and community."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Unique title tags for each page
- [ ] Meta descriptions under 160 characters
- [ ] Open Graph tags for social sharing
- [ ] Structured data for local business

### Task 12: Optimize Performance
**Prompt**: "Optimize all images to WebP format with JPEG fallbacks. Implement lazy loading for below-fold content. Inline critical CSS in base.html. Add preload tags for hero video and fonts."

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Images in WebP with fallbacks
- [ ] Lazy loading implemented
- [ ] Critical CSS inlined
- [ ] Core Web Vitals passing

## Parallel Execution Groups

**Group A (Parallel):**
- Task 1: Homepage view/template
- Task 2: Hero video background
- Task 3: Hero styling

**Group B (Parallel):**
- Task 4: Schedule view/template
- Task 5: Schedule styling
- Task 6: Booking integration

**Group C (Parallel):**
- Task 7: Pricing view/template
- Task 8: Pricing calculator
- Task 9: Pricing card styles

**Group D (Sequential):**
- Task 10: Mobile navigation
- Task 11: Page metadata
- Task 12: Performance optimization

## Success Metrics
- Hero section reduces bounce rate below 50%
- Schedule clearly displays Sunday classes
- Pricing calculator demonstrates savings
- All pages load under 2 seconds
- Mobile responsive on all devices
- CTAs have >5% click-through rate

## Risk Mitigation
- Provide static image fallback for video
- Test on multiple devices and browsers
- Ensure graceful degradation without JavaScript
- Monitor page load performance
- A/B test CTA button text and colors
